intro: Xolisma rubiginosa, commonly known as the red-stemmed dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, reddish stems and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while its flowers bloom in the spring and early summer. Xolisma rubiginosa is adapted to arid environments and has a deep root system that allows it to survive in harsh conditions.
